about.description:
fontTools is a library for manipulating fonts, written in Python. The
project includes the TTX tool, that can convert TrueType and OpenType
fonts to and from an XML text format, which is also called TTX. It
supports TrueType, OpenType, AFM and to an extent Type 1 and some
Mac-specific formats. The project has a BSD-style open-source licence.
about.summary: fontTools is a library for manipulating fonts, written in Python.

name: fonttools

about.description:
fontTools is a library for manipulating fonts, written in Python. The
project includes the TTX tool, that can convert TrueType and OpenType
fonts to and from an XML text format, which is also called TTX. It
supports TrueType, OpenType, AFM and to an extent Type 1 and some
Mac-specific formats. The project has a BSD-style open-source licence.
about.summary: fontTools is a library for manipulating fonts, written in Python.

about.description:
fontTools is a library for manipulating fonts, written in Python. The
project includes the TTX tool, that can convert TrueType and OpenType

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "fonttools" %}
{% set version = "4.46.0" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/fonttools-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 2ae45716c27a41807d58a9f3f59983bdc8c0a46cb259e4450ab7e196253a9853

build:
  number: 0
  skip: true  # [py2k]
  entry_points:
    - fonttools = fontTools.__main__:main
    - ttx = fontTools.ttx:main
    - pyftsubset = fontTools.subset:main
    - pyftmerge = fontTools.merge:main
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv

requirements:
  build:
    - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cython                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
  host:
    - cython
    - pip
    - python
  run:
    - python
    - brotli
    - munkres
    - unicodedata2 >=14.0.0  # [py<311]

test:
  imports:
    - fontTools
    - fontTools.ttLib
    - fontTools.cffLib
  commands:
    - pip check
    - fonttools --help
    - fonttools subset --help
    - ttx -h
    - pyftsubset --help
    # pyftmerge has no help option
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://github.com/fonttools/fonttools
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: fontTools is a library for manipulating fonts, written in Python.

  description: |
    fontTools is a library for manipulating fonts, written in Python. The
    project includes the TTX tool, that can convert TrueType and OpenType
    fonts to and from an XML text format, which is also called TTX. It
    supports TrueType, OpenType, AFM and to an extent Type 1 and some
    Mac-specific formats. The project has a BSD-style open-source licence.

  doc_url: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/fonttools
  dev_url: https://github.com/fonttools/fonttools

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - CJ-Wright
    - dopplershift
    - tacaswell

about.description:
fontTools is a library for manipulating fonts, written in Python. The
project includes the TTX tool, that can convert TrueType and OpenType
fonts to and from an XML text format, which is also called TTX. It
supports TrueType, OpenType, AFM and to an extent Type 1 and some
Mac-specific formats. The project has a BSD-style open-source licence.
about.summary: fontTools is a library for manipulating fonts, written in Python.
